Portfolio — Adam Obeng
experimental sociology software

Egopticon

egopticon, n. A construct from which the self can be observed at all times.

Etymology: From ego, 'I', and the suffix -opticon as in 'panopticon'

(It's also a Greek-Latin hybrid compound — sorry, linguistic prescriptivists).

Since moving back to Oxford at the beginning of this academic year, I've been recording all of my social interactions using my smartphone. I've logged all the new people I've met, and the topics of many of our conversations.

I am currently analysing the pilot sample 782 records of interaction over 87 days. The next step is to design a webapp I can use to efficiently capture and analyse further interactions.

The video to the right shows the evolution of the network of my in-person contacts over the first week. Edges represent instances of co-presence at which I was also present (i.e. meetings between two alters are only reported if I was also present). Obviously, some way of reporting multiple contacts between the same people (a multigraph) and of reporting contracts involving more than two people (a hypergraph). Interestingly enough, the same problem occurs for other ego-net data.

The eventual aim is to collate these real world interaction data with information about my online communication habits (from email, Facebook, etc.). Why? Because detailed micro-level data on social interactions are hard to find. Also, it might help me work out who are the most productive people to hang out with...
